primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God initiates a cosmic 'reaching out' to rescue humanity from the 'cooked goose' of death, culminating in the Resurrection, which then empowers the church to replicate this movement.

tekstueel_bewijs: Everything God does is a form of reaching out.
God, not wasting a moment, reached out for Abraham.
God... made himself one with all of us 'unfortunates'.
God seeking after his lost son and lost daughter.
The Son of God entered into solidarity with the wretched of the earth.

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The Resurrection Reality
tekstueel_bewijs: The church exists by mission as fire exists by burning.
Because God has given us the victory in Christ, therefore...
It is God seeking after you and me.
Thanks be to God, who gives us the victory.
You shall receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you.
Never underestimate the power of the heavenly grace of God to make us fruitful.

tegenstander.identificatie: Death / Sin / The 'Way of the World' (Cycles of Hatred)
tekstueel_bewijs: We were all justly condemned to death.
Death is swallowed up in victory.
The filthy Serbs... I will kill him.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but 'terminal' misfortune and cosmic death that humanity cannot break alone.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Subject) reaches out to the neighbor (Object) as a recapitulation of God's primary action.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christian Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly fueled by the success of the primary program (Resurrection power).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → Reaching out to the Lost

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord your God redeemed you.
Jesus took upon himself the condemnation.

voorbeelden: I command you to do this.
Knowing that in the Lord your labor is not in vain.
Resurrection power! This is more power than any bomb.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily focused on the endowment of 'Pouvoir' (Power) from an external source (Resurrection) to an incompetent subject (the 'unfortunates').

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Condemned in Egypt/Adam) to S1 (Victory in Christ) which enables the movement from ~S1 (fruitless) to active fruitfulness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the S2 position ('made himself unfortunate') to move the Receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'terminally unfortunate' and 'justly condemned'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the primary actor. Human action is framed as a 'recapitulation' or 'fruit' of God's prior and superior action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God being our helper, we will do what we can to teach him to be kind.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus took upon himself the condemnation unto death that we had incurred.
Acts of kindness are not performed to gain credit... they are living embodiments of the story of our own redemption.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Abraham and Moses are used as objects of God's reaching out, not as moral models for the hearer to imitate by their own strength.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God reached out to them, just as He reaches out to us.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of initiating the 'reach-out' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation leading to synergistic mission.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 1 Cor 15 (Resurrection) to 1 Cor 16 (Collection) is used as the structural anchor for the entire sermon.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'minuscule' nature of human charity and the 'cosmic' scale of the Resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus took upon himself the condemnation unto death that we had incurred.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented actantial structure where God is the Subject and the church is the Receiver-turned-Secondary-Subject.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it counters the 'Devoir' (Duty) usually associated with Mission Sunday.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace' while addressing concrete social and ethical issues.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the Byrd Machine anecdote; semiotics shows this anecdote functions to define the 'Unfortunate' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'diakonia'; semiotics explains how 'diakonia' is the Object of the church's secondary narrative program.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Outreach' is not a human work but a 'recapitulation' of the Divine Subject's movement.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God merely assists human effort.
